section.section:
If contraband alcoholic beverages or contraband tobacco products are seized:
the Comptroller or police officer shall give a notice of seizure to the person from whom the property is seized at the time of the seizure; and
the Comptroller shall:

If contraband motor fuel is seized, within 48 hours after the seizure, not including weekends and holidays, the Comptroller shall give a notice of seizure to:
the owner of the contraband motor fuel;
the registered owner of the seized conveyance; and
any secured party noted in the records of the Motor Vehicle Administration.
A notice of seizure shall state the right of an owner or other interested person, including a secured party of record, to file a claim for the return of the seized property.
A police officer who seizes a conveyance used to transport contraband alcoholic beverages promptly shall notify the Comptroller of the seizure.

A police officer who seizes any contraband tobacco products or conveyance used to transport contraband tobacco products shall deliver the seized cigarettes or other tobacco products and conveyance to the Comptroller.

A police officer who seizes any contraband motor fuel shall:
deliver the seized contraband motor fuel and conveyance to the Comptroller; or
if the seized conveyance is operated by a common carrier, regulated by either the Maryland Public Service Commission or the Interstate Commerce Commission, and transports motor fuel for another person, for a fee, direct the operator of the conveyance to take it to a location that the Comptroller designates.

text.section:
For a seized conveyance transporting contraband motor fuel that is operated by a common carrier, the Comptroller shall:
remove the contraband from the conveyance at the location that the Comptroller designates;
retain the contraband, subject to §§ 13-840 and 13-841 of this subtitle;
after removing the contraband, release the conveyance to its operator; and
reimburse the common carrier for all tariff charges applicable to the movement of the conveyance from:
the place of seizure to the location where the contraband motor fuel was removed; and
the place where the contraband motor fuel was removed to the nearer of the common carrier's home terminal or the place of seizure.
